quotes.t: As a claustrophobe—perhaps the only kind of {qword}neurotic{/qword} out of place in New York—I find nothing in the city more terrifying than a stalled subway car.

More than any rebirth, one senses in the England of 1911 a civilization's unconscious death wish, vividly present in the author's glimpses of the poet Rupert Brooke, that squeaky-clean {qword}neurotic{/qword}, a casualty waiting to happen.
You are too much something for a tubercular {qword}neurotic{/qword} who can only be jealous and mean and perverse.
